title: OH LOUISIANA

description.plain: “OH LOUISIANA” is a bridge between songs that interpolates the first verse from Chuck Berry’s “Oh Louisiana”. It reflects Beyoncé’s heritage, as her mother Tina is Louisiana Creole. Beyoncé has previously paid tribute to the state and her Southern roots on B'Day and Lemonade.

embed_content: Read “OH LOUISIANA” by Beyoncé on Genius

body.plain: “OH LOUISIANA” is a bridge between songs that interpolates the first verse from Chuck Berry’s “Oh Louisiana”. It reflects Beyoncé’s heritage, as her mother Tina is Louisiana Creole. Beyoncé has previously paid tribute to the state and her Southern roots on B'Day and Lemonade.
